newsitem.title: TURKEY: Istanbul gold volume jumps, prices mixed.
newsitem.headline: Istanbul gold volume jumps, prices mixed.

text.p: Traded volume on the Istanbul gold exchange jumped to 1,375 kilos on Thursday from Wednesday's 842 kilos on continuing physical demand from the free market, dealers said.

Gold closed unchanged in dollar terms at $348.80 an ounce, despite easing slightly on world markets. It fell in lira terms to 1,357,500 lira per gram versus the previous 1,361,000 as the lira firmed in dollar terms.

"There was early seasonal physical demand encouraged by the generally low world prices. There is a temporary shortage of gold imports because of the unexpected firm demand. This effectively stoppped prices from falling," one dealer said.
Banks are the main importers among the gold exchange members.
The lira closed at 120,850 lira to the dollar, compared to 120,900 lira on Wednesday.
Most of the day's trade -- 1,140 kilos -- was conducted in the morning session, and 64 percent of total turnover was in dollar terms.
